instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades?
Output: The related study used nir spectrum in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades were CARS, GA, SPA, and their synergic methods.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades and how far can this metric go?
Output: The specific metric that was chosen to evaluate the performance in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades was accuracy. The accuracies of all datasets were higher than 92.6% and 92.7% when using full-band models and fusion information, respectively.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades based on hyperspectral imaging (HSI), near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS), and their fusion information?
Output: Extreme learning machine models were used in the discrimination models of mutton freshness grades based on hyperspectral imaging (HSI), near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS), and their fusion information.

instruction: Can the full-band models of hyperspectral imaging (HSI) and near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) be considered superior to characteristic variable models in discriminating mutton freshness grades based on their accuracies?
Output: Yes, the full-band models of hyperspectral imaging (HSI) and near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) can be considered superior to characteristic variable models in discriminating mutton freshness grades based on their accuracies. The related study states that the full-band models of both HSI and NIRS showed good performance, with accuracies of all datasets higher than 92.6%. On the other hand, the model accuracy decreased gradually with the decrease of the variables number when modeling with characteristic variables. Therefore, the full-band models of HSI and NIRS outperformed the characteristic variable models in terms of accuracy in discriminating mutton freshness grades.
